page.title: 08GUY FAWKES' NIGHT AT DUFTON
page.content: The thing about the Youth Club is that it has members in so many families.So when they have a Bonfire Night,we're all there.Dufton is on a hill,& the bonfire is made down on the site of a former mill below the village.A steep bank backs it,& across the road another hill looks huge in the night. It is cold & we crowd in to keep warm at first,but soon have to back away or stand on the road,for the heat.Home made toffee,provided by several Mums, is handed round.We all bring a few fireworks & these are set on the fence posts on the roadside & lit one after the other.The bigger boys have rocket launchings at the top of the hill opposite,& you see the torches flicker up there amid much laughter & shout- ing.Some of the boys are men now, you realise.
